majority
noun
noun: majority; plural noun: majorities
1.
the greater number.
"in the majority of cases all will go smoothly"
synonyms: larger part/number, greater part/number, major part, best/better part, main part, most
A majority is the greater part, or more than half, of the total. It is a subset of a set consisting of more than half of the set's elements. "Majority" can be used to specify the voting requirement, as in a "majority vote". A majority vote is more than half of the votes cast.

message:
The UK didn't join the Euro because their main currency of trade, back in the late 80s and early 90s, was the USD.

Thatcher's government set the trading bands of the ERM (Euro pre-cursor) above all economist recommendations, lower band was DEM2.773=GBP1.

The USD lost value, meaning the GBP went with it. GBP breached the lower trading band and it crashed out of the ERM - sparking interest rate hikes to 15% and a nasty recession.

Great Britain, from Grande-Bretagne (French), meaning Big Brittany. 

Stemming from the fact that if you turn a map of Brittany (northwest France) pointy end up, it sort of looks like a map of Great Britain.
